newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal EDP sale likely slip to June.
newsitem.headline: Portugal EDP sale likely slip to June.

text.p: The partial privatisation of Portuguese state electricity company EDP could slip to June from mid-May to avoid a clash with the planned float of France Telecom, State Secretary for Industry and Energy Jose Penedos said.
Confirming a report in O Publico on Wednesday, Penedos said that seeking to sell shares in EDP at the same time as the French float could hurt the Portuguese operation.
"We are looking at mid-June," he told Reuters in a telephone interview.
The government plans to sell between 20 and 30 percent of the electricity concern although it has said the percentage could rise to 49 percent if the demand were there.

Penedos told Reuters that foreign electricity concerns, including companies in Britain and Spain, could be interested in taking part in the privatisation even though EDP had no need of a strategic partner.
The rules set a ceiling of five percent for any individual stake.
